page.title: 07Principal Features 1
page.content: Abergavenny is situated in an area of outstanding natural beauty.If you look to the North,West or South the nearby hills and mountains provide the background.The Sugar Loaf,the Blorenge and the Skirrid mountains are all within two miles of the town. Lying at the southern edge of the Black Mountains and close to the Brecon Beacons,Abergavenny has become a popular holiday centre.People come to enjoy the countryside and activities like hill-walking,pony-trekking,caving and canoeing attract many people. Enthusiasts of the relatively new sport of hang gliding have found that the Blorenge is an ideal site for their activities.The River Usk and its tributaries,which includes the River Gavenny,offer good salmon and trout fishing.
